STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 19, 2021
Robert Powell
Family Services & Children's Aid - Jackson County
PO Box 6128
330 West Michigan Ave.
Jackson, MI 49204
RE: License #: CB380201116
Family Service & Children's Aid - Jackson County
330 W Michigan
Jackson, MI 49204
Dear Mr. Powell:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
5/17/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may
not be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional
MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-08C Parent Agency Treatment Plan and Service Agreement
Upon completion of the parent-agency treatment plan and
service agreement, the parent is given a copy for review. Foster
care workers need to ensure the parent understands all areas
within the agreement. Parents and youths age 14 and older
must sign the PATP…
One of three foster care files did not have a signed PATP as required. The 9/27/20
PATP was missing the father’s signature.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
One of three foster care files held a Medical Passport that was not updated
quarterly.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings
Page 5 & 12
Semi Annual Transition Plan Meeting- Within 30 calendar days
after the youth’s 14th birthday and every six months thereafter.
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM
Two of three foster care files did not have FTMs completed as required.
File One: A semi-annual transition plan had not been completed since 11/19/19.
File Two: An FTM held on 6/23/20 did not have an accompanying 1105.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
PATP signatures- In one reviewed case, the child was placed with the non-
respondent parent. As the parent was not on the petition and did not have a
treatment plan developed, the agency did not require his signature on the child’s
PATP. However, the signature is still required as the parent is the placement for the
child. This requirement was verified with MDHHS policy office.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The CAP, approved 8/10/20, was required
as a result of the 7/8/20 interim review. The agency continues to follow the CAP and
has shown improvement in all previously cited areas; no repeat violations were
found.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, or contract. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
May 19, 2021
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 19, 2021
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
